text:
55F PMH diabetes, colon ca s/p resection and chemotherapy, liver
   cirrhosis (? etiology).  Initially admitted [**8-27**] to OSH for SOB, AMS,
   confusion and lethargy x 48 hours which was thought to be
   encephalopathy, treated with lactulose, fluids, pressors, IV ABX.
   Intubated [**8-30**] for respiratory distress and hypoxemia, later weaned
   from vent however mental status continued to be altered despite being
   off sedation.  EEG showing toxic metabolis slowing, CT head negative,
   neuro consulted and found brainstem reflexes intact but decreased
   higher cortical function.  Although on minimal vent support no
   improvement in mental status and therefore trached [**9-17**].  Transferred
   to [**Hospital1 1**] for liver workup.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Received pt on low dose propofol, arousable to voice however not
   tracking, withdrawing to sternal rub only, not following commands,
   persistent non-purposeful rhythmic movements of extremities, PERRL,
   cough/gag intact.  Afebrile and no infectious source at this time.
   Action:
   PO lactulose and rifaximin for hepatic encephalopathy, plan for LP to
   check for possible meningitis, liver consulted for possible SPB as
   infectious source.  Temp curve followed.
   Response:
   Pt having moderate amounts of liquid brown stool from flexiseal, no
   change in mental status, episodes of rhythmic movements continue.
   Remains afebrile.
   Plan:
   Multiple cultures pending, LP results, final CT results, continue PO
   regimen for encephalopathy, may need MRI.  Follow temp curve.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   Pt with multiple skin issues
 sacral, oral, facial, gluteal.
   Action:
   Pt on air mattress, turned frequently, sacral/gluteal mepilex dressings
   assessed with turns. Wound care consult ordered for sacral/gluteal
   wounds. UBE in this AM to evaluate as well.
   Response:
   Plan:
   Cirrhosis of liver, other
   Assessment:
   Pt with known cirrhosis from unknown etiology.  Pt has percutaneous
   gall bladder drain in place draining large amounts of serous colored
   fluid.  Pt slightly coagulopathic with elevated INR and decreased
   platelets.
   Action:
   Hepatology consulted, CBC/coags to be checked [**Hospital1 **], MICU team
   questioning DIC, FDP pending, safe environment maintained, blood draws
   minimized.
   Response:
   1500 labs show
   Plan:
   Hepatology following, continue to monitor CBC/coags, FFP if needed.
   Alteration in Nutrition
   Assessment:
   Received pt NPO, OGT clamped, placement checked by instilling air,
   minimal residuals, abdomen soft, non-tender.  Pt with lap band in
   place, meds given in minimal doses as tolerated.
   Action:
   Nutrition consult placed for tube feed recommendations. Surgery
   consulted for PEG placement give lap band in place.
   Response:
   Plan:
